creator: jorgeoliveira@seara.com
text:
Hi,

I'm running apache 2.0.43, php 4.3.0, mysql 3.23.54 on a dual processor 
windows NT4 SP6 machine with 1GB RAM... We also have Oracle 8 installed wich 
we access using odbc. We have about 100 unique visitors each hour, that 
normally corresponds to 5000 hits and 20 MB transfered.

After some time of apache being started, dr. watson appears saying apache as 
generated an application exception: access violation (c0000005). After that, 
it keeps appearing, each time sooner, until the moment apache simply hangs. 
Then I have to STOP and START apache (restart doesn't solve it) or even reboot 
the machine.

I've already followed every single suggestion I could find on the net and yet 
the problem persists. 

Any ideas would be much appreciated :)


Thanks in advance.

creator: jorgeoliveira@seara.com
text:
I just updated priority to 'High' because it's getting worse! 
I have over 20 dr. watson warnings on my desktop...

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
The Dr. Watson info is about the only way we can tell you what's broke.
  Please *attach* (don't paste it inline) to this bug report.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text: Hmm. AFAICS... It looks like a bug in winsock2... Bill?

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Indeed the bug is in wsasend.  Try enablesendfile off.

  You probably are running some firewall or other software which corrupts
  the network stack.
